title: [Large-scale] Learner-Centered Continuous Professional Development for Engineering Experts in High-Risk Industries

context.prior_knowledge: Basic safety management in hazardous industrial environments and engineering problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: A course where current practitioners deepen expertise by learner-led resolution of risk management issues arising in real work contexts

learning_goals: Learners analyze three real-world cases from high-risk industrial sites (construction, chemical, etc.) and develop a 5-step or fewer action plan (including risk assessment, response protocols, and training strategies) to improve safety decision-making processes, meeting at least four of five evaluation criteria.
Learners collaborate with peer experts to design and implement field-centered problem-solving strategies

Within three weeks, learners identify three technology stacks (e.g., Java, Spring Boot, AWS) related to public IT projects (e.g., e-government framework development) and submit a personalized learning roadmap to the instructor, including weekly learning goals (2 hours theory/3 hours practice) and assessment methods (80%+ on 10-question quizzes, 3-step checklist for practical assignments).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
